exercises.title: 3-Minute Calming Meditation
exercises.description: A quick breathing exercise to regain calm and clarity before important moments.
steps: Find a comfortable position. You can keep your eyes open with a soft gaze, or close them gently.
Begin by taking three deep breaths. Inhale slowly through your nose for 4 counts... hold for 2... exhale through your mouth for 6 counts.
Now let your breathing return to normal. Simply notice each breath without trying to change it.
Bring your attention to your body. Notice any areas of tension. With each exhale, imagine releasing that tension.
Take one final deep breath. As you exhale, open your eyes if they were closed. Notice how you feel.
exercises.closing: You've just given yourself a gift of presence. Carry this calm into your next interaction.

exercises.title: Box Breathing Exercise
exercises.description: A simple 4-4-4-4 breathing technique used by Navy SEALs to reduce stress.
steps: Sit upright in a comfortable position.
Inhale through your nose for 4 counts.
Exhale through your mouth for 4 counts.
Hold for 4 counts before inhaling again.
exercises.closing: With practice, box breathing becomes a powerful tool you can use anywhere.

exercises.title: Active Listening Practice
exercises.description: Practice the HEAR method to become a more present and effective listener.

steps.description: Stop what you're doing. Give full attention.
Make eye contact. Lean in slightly. Show you're present.
Expect to learn something. Approach with curiosity.
Paraphrase what you heard to confirm understanding.

exercises.practice_prompt: Think of an upcoming conversation where listening will be important. Who will you be speaking with? What assumptions might you need to set aside?

exercises.title: Delegation Self-Assessment
exercises.description: Assess your delegation patterns and identify opportunities to empower your team.
questions: What tasks are currently on your plate that someone else could do?
What's holding you back from delegating these tasks?
Who on your team would benefit from growth opportunities?
What support would they need to succeed?
What's one task you could delegate this week?

steps.description: Make it safe for them to share.

exercises.practice_prompt: Think of a conversation you've been avoiding. Using the STATE method, how would you open that discussion?
